title: Smart Machine and Simulation-Based Instructional Design: Theory and Practice

context.prior_knowledge: Elementary understanding of educational technology and instructional design, with hands-on experience in science fields
context.additional_context: A blended learning environment for post-secondary-educated adults using simulation tools on digital devices. Emphasis on designing education for real-life problem-solving.

learning_goals: Learners can systematically analyze and explain the advantages and disadvantages of educational applications of smart machines
Learners can diagnose real-world science education problems and propose improvement strategies through simulation-based instructional design
Learners can design educational content that supplements the limitations of science education simulations by referencing the 'The Oregon Trail' case
difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
